intro: Euplassa papuana, commonly known as the Papuan euplassa, is a flowering plant native to the tropical regions of Papua. It belongs to the family Rubiaceae, which includes a wide variety of shrubs and trees. The plant is characterized by its simple, opposite leaves and small, clustered flowers that are typically white or pale yellow. It thrives in humid, shaded environments and is often found in lowland forests. Due to its limited distribution, it is considered a rare and potentially endangered species.
